html:
Best with SPF

EltaMD UV AOX Tinted Eye Sunscreen SPF 30

Pros

  • Safe for sensitive skin

Cons

  • Shade may not be suitable for fair skin tones

Like eye cream, SPF is something you should use every day. This SPF eye cream contains a mineral sunscreen that blends into a wide range of skin tones thanks to its golden pigments.

Key ingredients: Zinc oxide, peptides, vitamin E, Persian silk tree extract

Size: 0.4 oz.

Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “80 percent of aging comes from the sun—knowing this, I want to protect my face, particularly the delicate under eye area. I apply this tinted eye sunscreen after my eye cream and before my primer. Don’t forget your crow’s feet!” —Danielle James, digital beauty director

Best with Retinol

Ilia Bright Start Retinol Alternative Brightening Eye Cream

Cons

  • May not be suitable to very sensitive skin

This eye cream features sea fennel extract, a plant-based alternative to retinol that smooths and firms the skin. The caffeine in the formula and the metal applicator de-puff, while the slight peachy hue brightens the eye area.

Key ingredients: Sea fennel extract, avocado extract, caffeine, peptides

Size: 0.5 oz.

Sephora rating: 4.3/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I’ve never been one to shy away from retinol. Now, the potent anti-aging ingredient—at least, an equally effective retinol alternative—has crept into my eyecare routine. The Ilia eye cream is the wild card of my skin care routine; caffeine, peptides, and sea fennel extract revive my tired eyes and keep any evidence of my 3 am TikTok scrolling to a minimum. Even more, the applicator doubles as a massage tool, so any puffiness can be soothed with just a few swipes.” —Nerisha Penrose, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for All Skin Tones

Colorscience Total Eye 3-in-1 Renewal Therapy SPF 35

Pros

  • Variety of shades to choose from

Cons

  • Some may need more coverage on top

This tinted eye cream is a dermatologist-favorite. “It’s gentle, non-irritating, and contains antioxidants, hyaluronic acid, and actives that preserve the integrity of blood vessels, a common cause of dark circles. In addition to SPF, it provides instant improvement in dark circles, puffiness, and dryness, owing to its light-reflecting formulation that comes in four shades to match all skin tones,” raves Dr. Rachel Westbay, a board-certified dermatologist at Marmur Medical. You’ll also appreciate the cooling metal applicator, which helps reduce puffiness before you start your day.

Key ingredients: Titanium dioxide, zinc oxide, hyaluronic acid, antioxidants

Size: 0.23 oz.

Colorscience rating: 4.7/5 stars

A Colorscience reviewer says: “I have been using this product for years! Won’t go without it. Love that it is a concealer, treatment, and has SPF all in one amazing product.”

Best Concealer

It Cosmetics Bye Bye Under Eye Full Coverage Anti-Aging Waterproof Concealer

Cons

  • Some reviewers noted creasing

Although this is technically a concealer, it “can also function as an eye cream in the morning because it contains anti-aging ingredients like peptides, hydrolyzed collagen, and hyaluronic acid,” says Dr. Westbay. The formula offers full coverage, so it really is a one-and-done product.

Key ingredients: Collagen, hyaluronic acid, peptides

Size: 0.4 oz.

Ulta rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Ulta reviewer says: “You don’t have to use much, and it has amazing coverage! I enjoy the coverage and dewy finish. If you are having trouble, I recommend moisturizing your under eyes/doing skin prep. Less is more sometimes with this product—use a setting powder and setting spray.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best with Niacinamide

First Aid Beauty Brighten + Glow Eye Cream with Niacinamide

Cons

  • Some reviewers saw visible sparkles

First Aid Beauty creates skin care hits time and time again, and this tinted eye cream is one of them. “It includes ingredients like caffeine, licorice root, and light-reflecting pigments to brighten and depuff,” says Dr. Westbay. The formula also includes niacinamide, which helps reduce darkness over time.

Key ingredients: Niacinamide, caffeine, licorice root

Size: 0.5 oz.

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I have genetic dark circles under my eyes that I am always trying to cover. This is a great base before I put on concealer/powder. It feels really nice going on and just subtly covers the darkness.”

Best Applicator

Replenix Tinted Brightening Eye Cream

Cons

  • May be prone to creasing

Sagging is a common issue that comes with age. Replenix’s tinted eye cream is formulated to infuse the skin with nutrients that help lift the skin and a pigment that camouflages the appearance of any hyperpigmentation and fine lines that might be present.

Key ingredients: Edelweiss flower, hyaluronic acid, peptides

Size: 2 oz.

Dermstore rating: 4/5 stars

A Dermstore reviewer says: “I have started to use this product in place of concealer for my daily look and love it. It brightens the under eye area and blends seamlessly with my tinted moisturizer. The only downside is minor creasing in the fine lines underneath my eyes, but it easily re-blends if I notice this throughout the day.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Color-Correcting

OleHenriksen Banana Bright+ Vitamin CC Eye Stick

Pros

  • Four shades for different skin tones

Cons

  • Can fade throughout the day

Dark under eyes that need some extra love will appreciate this eye cream stick and color corrector hybrid. Infused with vitamin C, the stick also works to fade darkness.

Key ingredients: Vitamin C, caffeine

Size: 0.14 oz.

Ulta rating: 4.6/5 stars

An Ulta reviewer says: “I love the Banana Bright Vitamin CC Stick! It completely erases my dark circles and doesn’t crease over time! It also seems to help improve the overall look slightly over time without the use of makeup. I would absolutely recommend this product.”

Best Brightening

Natura Bisse Diamond Cocoon Sheer Eye Cream

Pros

  • Suitable for sensitive eyes

Cons

  • Tint may not work for everyone

Environmental stressors like blue light and UV rays wreak all sorts of havoc on our under eyes, leading to fine lines, dark circles, and puffiness. The pigments in this Natura Bisse eye cream help blur imperfections, while water lily extract and hyaluronic acid nourish and hydrate the skin to give the eye area a boost.

Key ingredients: Detoxin, hyaluronic acid, water lily extracts

Size: 0.08

Dermstore rating: 4.4/5 stars

A Dermstore reviewer says: “I love this eye cream. It hides your dark circles very well and is moisturizing. I don't need to wear concealer anymore. The coverage is fairly light and sheer but it is enough for me. You won't feel it on your face like you do with makeup. Keep in mind that the price is for 25ml. Most eye creams are 15ml only.”

Best Hydrating

Medik8 Illuminating Eye Balm

Pros

  • Looks natural on all skin tones

Cons

  • May need more coverage for dark circles

Stayed awake a little too long last night binging your favorite new series? No problem—Medik8 has your back with the Illuminating Eye balm, which is rich with moisturizing and soothing ingredients and has a tint that softens any darkness you may have acquired from your wild night in.

Key ingredients: Red algae extract, hyaluronic acid, cucumber extract, glycerin

Size: 0.51 oz.

Dermstore rating: 4/5 stars

A Dermstore reviewer says: “It is soft and creamy, though not greasy. It is tinted, which I love. It is a great under-eye moisturizer. I will definitely order it again!”

Best Illuminating

Colleen Rothschild Illuminating Tinted Eye Cream

Cons

  • Cancels out blue-ish dark circles

The pearlized pigments in this tinted eye cream provide a subtle glow that makes you look more awake—even before you’ve had your first cup of coffee. Thanks to the efforts of hardworking ingredients, including hyaluronic acid and caffeine, wrinkles and puffiness will fade, too.

Key ingredients: Hyaluronic acid, caffeine, peptides

Size: o.5 fl. oz.

Colleen Rothschild rating: 4.3/5 stars

A Colleen Rothschild reviewer says: “Love this product! I have reordered it many times. I struggle with dark under eyes and have tried many different eye creams. This is the only one I have found that works to hide and brighten my eyes.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Meet the Experts

Are tinted eye creams safe?

According to Dr. Westbay, the consensus is that they’re generally safe as long as they’re made with the proper ingredients and used appropriately. However, if you’re feeling nervous, performing a patch test is always a good idea. “I say this all the time, but before using a new tinted eye cream, perform a patch test on a small area of skin to ensure you do not have an allergic reaction or irritation,” says Dr. Westbay.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Can you use tinted eye creams at night?

Not really—especially ones with SPF in them. “This is largely because sunscreens are formulated to protect your skin from UV radiation during the day. There is no UV exposure at night, so using sunscreen serves no protective purpose, and mineral-based SPFs are at the root of most tinted eye creams. On that note, some ingredients in sunscreens, including those that provide the tint, may not be ideal for overnight wear. They can potentially clog pores or irritate the skin if left on for extended periods without the need for sun protection,” says Dr. Westbay. Also, there’s really no need for any sort of tint at night, so it’s probably a better idea to slather on your regular eye cream instead.
